text: We had a great experience!  We ran into a few issues with wedding planning that I didn't anticipate and Event Rentals went above and beyond to make sure everything worked out for me, made a stressful day so much better!

name: Amy Marie Kelly
text: Was able to help my company with there picnic by renting us a raffle ticket drum.

name: Brielle Mathews
text: A good place to rent from - just be very specific with you need/want. We had a ribbon cutting event and we got everything we needed from them - but here's the problem. While most of the items were downstairs by the stage, some items were used upstairs by reception. The latter items were not found and whoever picked up most of the items left without them. Apparently they tried to pick them up two more times - but the receptionist said she never had them stop by. My guess is that he tried going through receiving and didn't ask anyone where the items were. When we spoke with the manager, he promised they'd be picked up Friday afternoon - well the delivery guy had a delay and couldn't make it that day despite the fact the items had been there for more than a week. If anything, the company is good but pickup/delivery is sketchy. Just be very clear with what you want and WHEN. and you should be fine.

text:
Changing my rating to a LESS THAN ONE STAR FOR BOTH LOCATIONS!!! I was so happy to originally give good rating to Alexander City store, I had found the 2 Lazy Boy recliners I had been searching for.... and she checked to make sure they were NOT on back order.. so image my surprise that now, 18 days later than they were promised, I STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED THEM, they have not been delivered to the store. I should have picked them up on April 2nd. Since then, I have been told "they will be on our next truck, call back Tuesday" "call back Friday"  "I called and verified that they would be in our warehouse the 16th" I'm leaving my original post, so everyone can see the whole story behind trying to get 2 recliners from your store!
I live in Sylacauga and went to our local Badcock store. I found the recliner that I had been searching for and asked if it was available in a different color. The sales lady rushed to answer "No" without checking their website or trying to verify her answer... I left there and went online, found the lady had lied and it WAS available in the color I wanted. So I drove to a neighboring city store and found a sales lady who was more than eager to help me... so I give the Sylacauga location a 1 Star rating, but the Alexander City location gets 5+ stars! Very happy with the lady there! Too bad I couldn't do business in my hometown.....

resp.text:
Hi Carroll,

Our sincerest apologies. Customer service is a priority for us, and we're sorry to see your experience was a disappointing one. Our Corporate Team would like to look into this for you. If there is anything we can do differently that might better serve you as our valued customer, please reach out by calling 1-800-223-2625 or email customer.service@badcock.com. We appreciate your feedback, and are glad to see you had a positive experience during your second visit to our store.

The store manager has adhd or something he can not focus and puts all his task down on me . He is impossible to work for, some days he doesn’t ask you to do anything other days he ask you to everything AND his job! He was never on time and always left early and takes long breaks. A lot of the time I was NOT allotted a lunch break but when I look at my pay stub the time was taken out of my check . You have too many responsibilities that you are not paid for ... Oan the store is really slow but the manager threw away the chairs and doesn’t want you to sit ! name: Stacy Wiggins
text:
I am so disappointed with our experience with Pre Events. I spent an incredible amount of time planning each of the tiniest details for our wedding and sacrificed a lot of extras to make it happen financially.

When I arrived to the venue the day of the wedding, I realized that Pre Events had delivered the wrong tables. I spent the first thirty minutes of my time there crying because I had spent so much time planning every detail and these tables looked absolutely nothing like the ones I had ordered. Unfortunately despite the efforts of my MOH and wedding planner, there was no time to have the tables swapped out. It was a hard pill to swallow but I married the man of my dreams that day and tried to let it go with promises that the company would do something to make it up to us.

I have never been talked to the way I was talked to by the VP of this company, Mike. He said the mix up was our fault. BRIDES BEWARE. When you go to their landing page for tables, there are no names. You will only find the item name and detail if you click on each individual photo. Mike said the miscommunication happened when I chose the “farm table” available in the Auburn location but their sales rep in Birmingham thought I wanted the “farm table” in the Birmingham location. With Auburn being only a drive away, and also not even knowing about the other “farm table” I just assumed that the delivery fees included getting me the tables from Auburn.

Not once did their sales rep mention that they had two tables by the same name. Not once did she try to clarify. And to have my wedding day tarnished, TO BE TOLD THAT IT WAS MY FAULT, was completely disappointing to say the least.

We spent around $6000 total with this company. And if I could do it all again I would’ve given every cent to a company that cares about its customers.

Trying to let go of the fact that a big business wins again and this will never be made right.

I have never been insulted and treated so poorly. 1st....they attempted to deliver my furniture incomplete. Was going to deliver and setup the entire bedroom and make me wait 2-3 days for my mattress. Whoever heard of such a thing? If we didn’t call the day before, they would’ve done it.

Their solution was a HUGE insult!!! $99 credit!!

When we called to discuss with manager, he kept passing comments and words through a sales rep and not wanting to come to phone to talk with an upset customer.

Additionally, we were told we should receive a call in a couple days from a manager that never occurred. After 3 days, we contacted corporate with same results. They told us that they will forward to a district manager and they will call us in a couple days.

This place is HORRIBLE!!! I will NEVER recommend or shop at the Oxford Alabama Branch ever again. I would pay more at another store/furniture place before going back to this store!!! If I could give negative stars, I would!!!

text: I normally do not leave lengthy reviews but I've really noticed a considerable change over the last year regarding customer service, management, and my overall shopping experience. I have purchased the majority of my home's furnishings and appliances just over the last six months alone as I have been remodeling. Your Sales Manager, Nicholas, is warm and inviting. He has gone above and beyond to meet and exceed my needs (from helping to select the right colors and fabrics of my furnishings to match and contrast properly down to suggesting the Porter Cable tools for my many DIY projects), and has even made this whole remodeling process much easier. He has truly made me feel like family as I know I am welcome to contact him at any time with my many questions. Both Katie, the store manager, and Nicholas are huge assets to Rent-A-Center, imho. Anyhow, had these changes not occurred you all would have lost me as a customer due to the previous management., so kudos to you for stepping up! In addition,  they have been incredibly helpful and supportive during the current pandemic of COVID-19. So, if anyone has had a bad experience in the past, go see Nicholas and Katie. text: I am a first time customer of Rent a Center. This will also be my last time. I will NEVER do business with these people again. I came in looking for a playstation. To begin with they were great. They said no problem and brought me out a 500 GB playstation. I got it home and....well let's just say it IMMEDIATELY went back. It came with FREE bugs. They told me it would be a few days before they would be able to get me another. So I waited. Finally they called and said they had a brand new one in. I went to pick it up and turns out it was brand new but it had more storage. They said that the whole thing was their fault so they wouldnt charge me anymore and gave me an extra controller. Turns out THEY LIED! BECAUSE THEY GAVE ME A PS4 FILLED WITH BUGS, THEY CHARGED ME FOR THE EXTRA SPACE AND THE EXTRA CONTROLLER THEY TOLD ME WOULDNT COST ME ANY EXTRA! So at this point I'm already aggravated. It gets much worse. I'm standing in line to pay one day, and the 2 customer reps were speaking to each other. The one lady said "Weve got people that haven't paid  in almost 4 weeks. If they would just pay on time we wouldnt have to go repossess their things". Okay no big deal. Every now and then I get a week behind. BUT I ALWAYS CALL AND LET THEM KNOW AND I ALWAYS PAY FOR 2 WEEKS PLUS THE EXTRA FEES THEY TAK ON!!!! ALWAYS! The most recent week I was 5 days late. I called them and told them. And they had the audacity to tell me they would have to come and take it if I didn't come pay it within 2 days. I ONLY HAVE 100$ LEFT AND YOUVE GOT PEOPLE THAT ARE 4 WEEKS LATE AND YOURE GOING TO COME TAKE MY PLAYSTATION THAT I HAD TO WAIT AN ENTIRE WEEK ON BECAUSE OF YOUR MESS UP!!!! YOU ADD EXTRA FEES!!!! YOU LIED AND MADE ME PAY MORE BECAUSE OF YOUR MISTAKE!!!! I told my mother and sister in Law yall were great to go get Washer and Dryers and TVs from. I gave yall business and this is how I get treated? When I pay the playstation off I will NOT be getting my Sofa from you. I will go to Aaron's and NEVER BE back. I will tell my mother and Sister and Law to go to Aarons. I will review you on every social media account I can because of how you treated me. My email is parks.samantha1031@gmail.  Fix this and I will gladly change my review. My Playsation should have been FREE for the mess you made. I've never in my LIFE! I expect an email or a phone call to fix this. Then again it's looking like money comes before customers.

resp.text: We take pride in our product hygiene and cleanliness, Samantha. We have very strict cleanliness standards for all of our products. We retain professional relationships with third party vendors to scrutinize our best practices, and support our continued efforts in maintaining product integrity. Your feedback is important to the RAC experience, and I have escalated the opportunity to your District Manager, Robert. name: Cheryl Smith
text: My husband and I went by Furniture and Mattress warehouse at the suggestion of my parents. They had a good experience with the owner/manager Josh Johnson so we decided to check the store out. Our visit went great, we ordered a Stearns and Foster mattress, a couch, and a chair. $1500 including delivery. Josh told us he would be going out to Atlanta the following Thursday, February 2nd, to pick up our couch and chair and have it delivered Friday or Saturday. He'd call to set up the final details. The mattress, however, he could get to us by Monday the 30th. We set up a delivery time for 3:00. Josh stated he would call me the morning of the 30th as a reminder. Up to this point, everything was great. Until Monday the 30th rolls around, it's 3:00 and there's no reminder phone call or delivery person. I call Josh and he asks if the delivery could be changed to 5:00. OK. Fine. No problem. Five o'clock rolls around. Nothing. Six o'clock. Seven o'clock. Finally, after being stood up repeatedly, my husband (the second of the two men delivery...That we paid for) helped Josh load the California-king mattress into the house. My husband is a disabled veteran and large part off his disability is his back. It is now the 9th of February and we have not received a single phone call from Josh about our couch and chair. I've called him nine times. Once while standing in front of him yesterday. He informs me that their number has changed as of that morning. Mine hadn't. He never called me. Though it expressly states, via their own contract, that if there are any shipping or delivery set backs they will contact me immediately to let me know. So, on Monday, February 6th my husband goes to the store to inquire as to what is going on. Josh tells my husband that they're having some delivery issues but we'll definitely have our furniture by Friday. He'd be giving us a call to set up a time. However, by Wednesday afternoon still no call. So, I went to the store Wednesday afternoon and Mr. Johnson tells me that we 'should' have our furniture by Tuesday. When I asked him why he hadn't kept me informed he said he was busy keeping up with his other customers and if he neglected to call he was sorry. I asked him why he hadn't returned my calls when the number has only recently changed. Surely he got them. No. He says he never got a single one of the many phone calls I made. Then I ask him if he has my number. He says he wrote it down wrong. That's funny, because he knew it when he was talking to my husband, and it's clearly written in our contract/receipt. Oh. And he tells me they're getting out of the furniture business. Be WARY, folks. Be VERY wary. All I'm asking for is common courtesy. Keep me in the loop. I'm not unreasonable. At this point, however, if I do not receive my furniture by this Tuesday I will proceed to take civil action through litigation if I am not given a full refund of the cost of the delivery fees, couch, and chair that I have paid.

text: Rented a "mister" fan for our sons birthday, and luckily we tried it out before using with our guests. Bc only 2 the nozzles worked properly and had valves.  The water was spraying directly into the fan motor.  So my husband did his best to fix it with no luck.  The fan itself was very beat up and barely a difference between low and high.  Upon returning the fan a manager told my husband only $10 of our $60 could be refunded.  Also admitted there were new mister kitsch the back but the guys didn't want to install them...

resp.text: Mrs. Fields, I apologize for the problems that you experienced. I have investigated this incident and I discovered that it was a new 'Mister Kit' that was on your fan, but unfortunately it was malfunctioning. Upon return of the fan we offered your husband a refund, but he said to charge him for the fan, "Because the fan worked and we used it." Well, the 42 inch Fan rents for $50 and the Mister Kit addition is only $10 - hence the $10 refund. Again, I apologize to you for the malfunctioning Mister Kit.  I would love the opportunity to make it up to you by offering you a full $60 credit toward any future rental item. Mistakes happen, but we want to make it right with you!

I will never do business with Bestway furniture rental again. I had a washer and dryer that I paid over the past year literally about 2,200.00 including interest and weekly payments. They lied to me and told me they would be paid off by now.
I have had to have the dryer replaced twice and the washer replaced because of substandard used products. The poorest quality I've ever seen.
I got behind by a week and I pulled up at my home at 8a.m. and the Bestway truck had been stalking my house and they pulled up quickly blocking me in like some repo man. It was rediculously dramatic.
They took the washer and dryer away as if I was some terrible customer that was several months behind. It was insane. I'm never doing business with these people again and I recommend you stay far away if in need of rental furnishings. Go to Arrons or Rent A Center.

All they would say is we have ordered them we're waiting.Needless to say Vincent and the rest of his employees are nothing but Liars it's been a year-and-a-half my furniture is paid off and I still do not have any knobs. And when I called to complain about her being rude she pretended that she didn’t do it. Today is due day not late day I don’t appreciate the rude people that call with the attitudes like the furniture is their furniture and the money belongs to them. You can get more bees with honey than with sour milk.

name: Michael Davies
text: i entered this establishment on 8/25/2020, i was greeted by an employee who was not wearing a face covering. i myself had on my face mask per state and city mandate. i proceeded to the counter to inquire about leasing merchandise. (i have leased with this company on a previous occasion, my experience at that time was very sub par. the delivery was late and the dryer power cord  was damaged to the point of causing property damage to my wall plug in my home.) A red headed woman approached the counter with no mask and asked me "how can i help you?", i replied i am looking to lease a laptop. she then told me "i have the desktop over there" i stated then what kind of laptops do you have " the kind that turn on!" she stated. so i disregarded her unprofessional remark still uneasy about both employees not having on a face covering, and asked to know my options of computer choices. she then with an attitude that i was an inconvenience to her began putting laptop boxes on the counter. i read the specifications and made my choice. she asked if i had leased with them before, i stated yes. it had been more than 30 days since my last lease so i was directed to fill out another lease application. during this time of filling out the application i came to find out the employee that was behaving in this manner was the general manager. she then informed me while i was filling out the rental application that she "hated these mask" and that i did not have to wear mine while in the store. i was now fully uncomfortable from a collection of lack of safety procedure during a pandemic. i continued to wear my mask. once the application was complete another employee then took a copy of my drivers license. the general manager took another 10 minutes to ask me to please come into her office. she was pulling up things on her computer. she then turned to me and rolled her eyes and said" so you have rented from us before huh? " i said yes i have multiple times. she then proceeded to question why i was late on my rental payment. i told this brute of a woman that i had financial hardship and lost my job at the time. i got behind on the lease and once i realized i could no longer afford to get the payments from these loan sharks up to date due to exorbitant late fees and penalties i returned the leased merchandise. she then stated that she "believed in giving second chances". i  acknowledged the comment but did not rebut to the comment. she then looked over more information on her computer. and turned to me and said " being late im ok with, but people keeping merchandise that is not theirs im not ok with!!" at this point i have become very uncomfortable and feel as if my visit to the store this day has become a humiliation session for the store manager. i stopped the woman and told her i felt degraded and would no longer like to do business with this establishment. she then laughed at me and said " fine then". i contacted the corporate office for this company and was informed they condone this behavior. a few notes if you intend to rent from this establishment, you may be exposed to covid 19 by employees or other patrons due to lack of adherence of mask mandate while in this location or lease merchandise that has not been sanitized properly. you will be belittled by the staff if you ever have financial hardship while in a lease agreement with this company as well. i hope this review is helpful to those thinking of leasing from this company. i would recommend the better competitor YOURWAY RENT TO OWN which is located at 2547 Bob Wallace ave. when i left this establishment i went to your way and was able to lease a laptop computer in less than 15 minutes without being belittled or shamed. (quick your way rent to own history) they do not charge daily late fees(best ways policy is built to extort with late fees)  when a payment may be late and will work with you if you hit financial hardship. also the merchandise is of higher quality, the facility is cleaner, with more inviting more professional staff. stay safe out there in this pandemic!

text: I visited the store in Troy, AL   I specifically told the sales clerk that I wanted to purchase a living room suit on the no interest plan.  This was on a Saturday and she gathered my information.  She sent it in and told me initially that I was denied.  After review, she indicated that the denial was on an old address.  Once she entered my correct address she told me I was approved.  She asked me did I want to make a down payment but did not indicate that the interest free was subject to a down payment.  So, I declined to make a down payment.  Upon receiving my first statement it indicated I was charged interest.  When I talked to the same lady she indicated that approved the account that charged interest.  No, I did not.  She neglected to give me the full details.

resp.text:
Customer service is incredibly important to us, and we regret we didn't provide you with the
experience you expected, Joanna. If there is anything we can do differently that might better serve you as

name: Valerie Edelmann
text:
Needed to purchase a lift chair that can also be laid back far enough to sleep in it for my husband. Due to my own health issues,  I  needed to call prior to going into the store to get as much information as possible about the choices. A wonderful young lady named "Turtle" helped me on the phone.But she wouldn't be there when I could be there. She told me her sister would be there and Mechel would make sure Turtle got credit for the sale. (I had wanted Turtle to get the credit since she took so much time helping me.) When we got there to the store, Mechel was so sweet and ready to help. We ended up purchasing 2 matching chairs to be delivered on Friday! (He has impending hip surgery and I need knee surgery.)

In a time when customer service has decreased and prices have increased, the quality customer service at our Badcock's is greatly appreciated!

resp.text: It was a pleasure to have you shop with us, Valerie! Thank you for taking the time to rate our store and share your feedback.
